gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util

Class Precondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util.Precondition

  • public final class Precondition
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods to verify preconditions of non-private class method. The methods of this class throw an IllegalArgumentException, when the asserted condition is not met. This supports a programming-by-contract style.

    "Wikepedia": the whole idea is that code should "fail hard", with the contract verification being the safety net. DBC's "fail hard" property makes debugging for-contract behavior much easier because the intended behaviour of each routine is clearly specified. The contract conditions should never be violated in program execution.

    Example: 

           public boolean doTask(MyClass myObject) {
           Precondition.assertNotNull("myObject", myObject);
           ...
       }

    Furthermore, this class reduces the verbosity of precondition assertion and more clearly expresses the intent. Compare the example to: 

           public boolean doTask(MyClass myObject) {
        if (myObject == null) {
                throw IllegalArgumentException("myObject: "
                        + " Expected a non-null value"); 
        }
          ...
       }

    For invariants and post-conditions asserts should be used, as the programmer has control over these conditions. Also, for private methods asserts should be used, as the programmer has control over these conditions.

      • assertBetween

        public static void assertBetween(java.lang.String argument,
                 java.lang.Number value,
                 java.lang.Number lowerBound,
                 java.lang.Number upperBound)
        Asserts that the given number value lies between an lower and an upper bound value.
        Parameters:
        argument - The name of the argument to check
        value - The value to check
        lowerBound - The lowerbound value. Value must be > lowerBound. If lowerbound is null, negative infinity is assumed.
        upperBound - The upperbound value. Value must be < upperBound. If upperbound is null, infinity is assumed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the value > 0
